basics.name: MinSuan Teh
basics.label: Software Engineer at InsiderSecurity
basics.summary:
I have recently Joined InsiderSecurity as a Software Engineer where I focus on developing innovative cybersecurity products, ranging from back-end to front-end development, algorithms, and DevOps. I employ my skills to create clean, efficient code, accompanied by comprehensive tests to ensure quality and stability.

Previously, I worked at Huawei as a Global Technical Service Engineer, providing software services regarding Huawei's Convergent Billing System. This role aligns with my interest in global tech solutions and involves ensuring system performance and reliability for international clients.

I'm a graduate of The University of Edinburgh, focusing on machine learning, game theory, IoT systems, algorithms, and data structures. My interest particularly lies in reinforcement learning algorithms.

My experience during my university life includes tutoring and marking for informatics students, teaching Java, and enhancing my communication skills. I've also led software projects, including developing a human activity recognition Android application, which was both challenging and rewarding. 

In my free time, I enjoy playing video games and board games.
